intro: Hieracium besseanum, commonly known as the Bessean hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grassy areas and along roadsides, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are hairy and lance-shaped, while its flowers are yellow with a central disk. Hieracium besseanum is often found in disturbed habitats and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
